Articles.Content:
Hello all,

well, IÃ‚Â´m playing KSP for since its release on Steam. IÃ‚Â´ve already build some things in kerbins orbit and on its moons, like a little moonbase an space station. IÃ‚Â´m really enjoying this game, unlike other games KSP seems to become more and more interesting as more you do, especially when youÃ‚Â´ve done a great step in your space program and then want to do more

IÃ‚Â´m now preparing my first manned interplanetary mission to Duna.

IÃ‚Â´d watched the Forums now for quite a while and finally decided to make an account to get a bit better involved into the community

Please ignore grammar and spelling errors, IÃ‚Â´m from Germany and my written English is probably not the best

Greetings from Northern Germany

Welcome to the Forums! No worries about your English. It's fine! If you make a lander that can make orbit in kerbin, it should have plenty of fuel to land on duna, take off, and return home. I didn't do the calculations when I built mine, but I imagined it would be about the same. Good luck and post some pictures of your mission!

P.S. - Remember aerobraking is your friend when you arrive at duna and when you return to kerbin!

Edited May 8, 2013 by Xiphos
Welcome to the wonderful KSP Forums!

Thx

IÃ‚Â´ve already planned the landing on Duna, just waiting for the transfer window. If everything works fine IÃ‚Â´ll just need ~2500 delta-v for the spaceship and 2200 for the lander, but failure is always an option as I noticed, especially in KSP

Cool, I'm nearly on the same step as you are, planning my first mission to Duna!

And it's as you say, you make a "giant leap", and the next one just awaits you

Happy Landing!

Malakai
